basics.name: Julia Berndtsson
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: Swedish phycisist focused on quantum engineering.

work.name: Yale University
work.summary: Researching superconducting processor architecture designs, and computational methods to enchance high-precision measurement.

work.name: Google Quantum AI
work.summary: Researced superconducting processor architecture designs, and implementations of simulation on quantum processors.

work.name: Princeton Univeristy
work.summary: Researced semiconductor spin qubits with a focus on measurment techniques and processor designs.

work.name: Harvard-Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics
work.summary: Discovered the first planet candidate in an external galaxy using X-ray transits.

projects.name: Prospect Student Ventures
projects.summary: Managing Director for Princeton's Venture Captial club. Allocated funding to Princeton-founded startups via equity-free grants and ran initiatives to foster entrepreneurship on campus.

education.institution: Yale University, Department of Applied Physics

awards.title: Engineering Physics Senior Thesis Award
awards.summary: This prize is awarded to the 'Engineering Physics student whose independent work or thesis is deemed most outstanding by the Engineering Physics faculty.'

awards.title: Manfred Pyka Memorial Prize
awards.summary: This prize is given to 'outstanding Physics undergraduates who have shown excellence in course work and promise in independent research.'

awards.title: Super Nova of the Year
awards.summary: The professionals' list identifies the best talent across 11 key sectors of the economy who have achieved outstanding results and a driving positive impact. Selected as the top candidate nation-wide.

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).
